title: On the Difference between Admissible and "Differentiable" Hamiltonians
abstract: It is shown that the Regge-Teitelboim criterion for fixing the unique boundary contribution to the Hamiltonian compatible with free boundary conditions should be modified if the Poisson structure is noncanonical. The new criterion requires cancellation of boundary contributions to the Hamiltonian equations of motion. In the same time, boundary contributions to the variation of Hamiltonian are allowed. The Ashtekar formalism for gravity and hydrodynamics of the ideal fluid with a free surface in the Clebsch variables are treated as examples.
